title: White House weighing Biden trip to NATO's newest member
description: President Biden is considering a visit to Finland, NATO's newest member, to coincide with the 30-member bloc’s July summit in Lithuania, sources told NBC News.

title: Netanyahu calls DeSantis, Trump and Biden ‘great friends’ of Israel
description: In an interview with NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu detailed his visit from Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and faced questions about the country’s controversial judicial overhaul.

title: Historic Stone of Scone moved from Edinburgh Castle ahead of King Charles’ coronation
description: The Stone of Scone, also known as the Stone of Destiny, was moved ceremoniously from Edinburgh Castle to make its way down to London for King Charles’ coronation. The block of sandstone is believed to have been used by monarchs in coronations as far back as the ninth century.

title: Dutch court bans sperm donor who fathered at least 550 children
description: A Dutch court on Friday banned a man from donating any more of his sperm after he fathered at least 550 children in the Netherlands and other countries and misled prospective parents about the number of offspring he helped to conceive.

title: More than a dozen dead after Russian airstrike in Ukraine
description: More than a dozen people were killed in after a wave of Russian missiles struck a residential apartment building in Uman, Ukraine, in the first major attack in nearly two months. NBC News’ Ellison Barber reports from Uman.

title: Egypt says Netflix's portrayal of Cleopatra as a Black woman is a 'blatant historical fallacy'
description: Egypt has accused Netflix of misrepresenting history by casting a Black woman to play Cleopatra in a new series.

title: Smoke rises over Sudan's capital as cease-fire extension appears to break down
description: Black smoke was seen billowing over Khartoum as strikes from the air, tanks and artillery shook Sudan's capital, even though the army and a rival paramilitary force had agreed to extend a truce by 72 hours.

title: Historic Stone of Scone is moved to London for King Charles’ coronation
description: The historic Stone of Scone, the ancient coronation stone upon which monarchs in Britain have been crowned for centuries, has left Scotland for London under tight security ahead of next week’s coronation of King Charles III, officials said on Friday.

title: Heavy clashes rock Sudan’s capital despite truce extension
description: Heavy explosions and gunfire rocked Sudan’s capital, Khartoum and its twin city of Omdurman early Friday, residents said, despite the extension of a fragile truce between the county’s two top generals whose power struggle has killed hundreds.

title: China says India border is stable, contrasting with Indian view
description: China’s defense minister says conditions along the tense, high-altitude border with India are “stable overall,” in sharp contrast with the far more pessimistic view from New Delhi.

title: Turkey’s Erdogan cancels third day of election appearances after falling ill
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan canceled his election appearances for a third day Friday after falling ill with what officials described as an intestinal infection.

title: Russia unleashes biggest wave of airstrikes on Ukraine for nearly two months
description: In the Ukrainian city of Uman, about 134 miles south of Kyiv, firefighters battled a raging blaze at a residential apartment building that had been struck on an upper floor by Russian cruise missiles. At least 10 people were killed, including two children, and nine were taken to a hospital, the regional governor said.

title: Russia kills at least 12 in biggest Ukraine air strikes for nearly two months
description: Russia hurled missiles at cities across Ukraine as people slept early on Friday, killing at least 12 people in the first large-scale air strikes in nearly two months.

title: Giant panda Ya Ya returns to China from Memphis
description: Ya Ya the giant panda landed in Shanghai after departing from Memphis Zoo in Tennessee, where she spent the past 20 years on loan.

title: New footage shows last moments of slain Japanese journalist in Myanmar
description: The missing camera of a slain Japanese journalist has resurfaced after 15 years, showing the final moments before he was killed. NBC’s Keir Simmons has more on how his family is speaking out and hoping that the images once again sheds light on Myanmar’s brutal military regime.

title: New play centers on rare Auschwitz photographs
description: Never before seen photos that documented the lives of Nazi officers at Auschwitz are now being turned into a Tectonic Theater Project production titled “Here There Are Blueberries.” NBC’s Valerie Castro was with the cast when they saw the original photographs from the rare collection for the first time.
